qa_pairs.question: What is Sunshine Powers' view on the current state of Union Square and housing in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I really don't know why we are just letting Union Square sit the way it has set. I don't understand why we're not housing people. The Hilton closed, great, don't we have monies from like propsy to like buy a bunch of stuff? Why can't we buy that? Why can't we house people? Can't we declare a state of emergency on housing and do a bunch of stuff? We have the capability now as a city with all the empty offices and hotels.
qa_pairs.source_text: I really dont know why we are just letting Union Square sit the way it has set and we its just like this thing its just keep on building and building and I really feel like I mean theres flowers there now thats nice I cant theres so many flowers there but um I dont understand why were not housing people I dont understand why okay the Hilton closed great dont we have monies from like propsy to like buy a bunch of stuff like why cant we buy that you know and I mean why cant we House people cant we declare a state of emergency on housing and like do a bunch of stuff without like a like Im pretty sure we can do that I might not be correct but we can do something like that where we can actually House people

qa_pairs.question: What does Sunshine Powers suggest for housing essential workers in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Why are we not housing our police cadets, our teachers, or our social workers? These just all are things that don't make sense, especially because we actually have that capability now as a city with all the empty offices and hotels.
qa_pairs.source_text: why are we not housing our police Cadets you know why are we not housing our teeth our teachers or our social workers these just all are things that dont make sense especially because we actually have that capability now as a city with all the empty offices all the empty hotels

qa_pairs.question: What community services does Sunshine Powers believe San Francisco needs?
qa_pairs.answer: We need more trash cans and a leaf blower. We need to be cleaner as a city if we're trying to attract tourists. We need more bathrooms, and the idea of lockers is imperative for curbing car theft.
qa_pairs.source_text: do I have any other community services that I would like to see in San Francisco first of all we need more trash cans and we need like a leaf blower like I am a nature girl I had the friends of urban forests do my sidewalk Schnoodle snore but like theres a lot of leaves on this street and like everywhere and its like it needs we need to be a cleaner as a city if were trying to attract the tourists thats been like 10 million bucks an hour and tax revenue inside the city like we need a nice city we need it to look good we need more bathrooms the fact that we have the Buena Vista bathrooms that arent 24 hours a day

qa_pairs.question: What is Sunshine Powers' opinion on the use of vacant storefronts in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I really don't know why we don't use these vacant storefronts for scooter charging and drop-off because I'm really annoyed that people just leave scooters at random spots.
qa_pairs.source_text: I really dont know why we dont use these vacant storefronts for the scooter Char charging and drop off because Im really annoyed that people just leave scooters at random spots

qa_pairs.question: What are Sunshine Powers' thoughts on the effectiveness of the tent camps in the Haight?
qa_pairs.answer: Camp was really good for us as the Haight. It definitely worked for some people. While it's not an overall solution, there are a few people that it works for who can't be inside but need a safe spot to go.
qa_pairs.source_text: but Camp was really good for us as the hate you know we have one woman that anyone whos in the hate knows me um and um you know she used to be a model on Vogue magazine and she is just I dont know if Im allowed to swear on this too too just a Sunday like she is gone and its an issue every day you know Ill see her lying in the middle of the road crying and like its just and its not we shouldnt see that she shouldnt be there like its just and when we had Camp I didnt see her for eight months she didnt leave so while its not it definitely worked for some people is it a overall solution no are there a few people that it works for that cant be inside but do need a safe spot to go yes

qa_pairs.question: What is Sunshine Powers' perspective on supporting small businesses in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I think helping sustain San Francisco is really supporting the small businesses in the community because I've seen a lot of big businesses come and go. We're still here, we're not going anywhere, and I think supporting communities is imperative.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think helping sustain San Francisco San Francisco is really supporting the small businesses in the community because Ive seen a lot of big businesses come and they go theyll sign a five-year lease they get some tax breaks all that stuff happens they cause a bunch of and they leave were still here were not going anywhere and I think supporting communities is imperative

qa_pairs.question: What does Sunshine Powers appreciate about San Francisco's culture?
qa_pairs.answer: What's so amazing about San Francisco is that you can be whoever you want to be as long as you're good. It's a really beautiful thing, and I hope that the magic, the historical side of San Francisco stays.
qa_pairs.source_text: whats so amazing about San Francisco is that you can be whoever you want to be as I feel as long as youre good youre good in the city and I think its just this really beautiful thing so I just hope that the Magic the beat the historical side of San Francisco Cisco stays
